item.title: Threads, an Instagram app
item.description: - Threads is a new text-based conversation app developed by Instagram.

item.title: Goodreads was the future of book reviews, then Amazon bought it
item.description: - Goodreads, an Amazon-owned review site for books, has faced criticism for its outdated infrastructure and lack of protective features, leading to targeted harassment and "review bombing" incidents.

item.title: 55 GiB/s FizzBuzz (2021)
item.description: - The post discusses the FizzBuzz challenge, which involves writing a program that prints numbers with certain conditions.

item.title: Joins 13 Ways
item.description: - A join in databases is a way to combine data from multiple tables based on a common column or attribute.

item.title: Where in the USA is this?
Leaking Bitwarden's Vault with a Nginx vulnerability
item.description: - Nginx, a popular web server, has potential vulnerabilities related to misconfigurations in the location and alias directives.

item.title: Ask HN: Who is hiring? (July 2023)
item.description: - The post is titled "Ask HN: Who is hiring?

item.title: Ask HN: Are people in tech inside an AI echo chamber?
item.description: - This post asks if people in the tech industry are only exposed to information and opinions that reinforce their own beliefs about artificial intelligence (AI).

item.title: Data-Oriented Design (2018)
item.description: - The post is an online release of a book called "Data-Oriented Design" which focuses on the importance of data in software development and provides insights on various topics related to data-oriented design.

item.title: An interactive guide to SVG paths
item.description: - The d attribute in SVG code is a series of commands that tell the browser how to draw a path.
